intro: Echium distachyum, commonly known as the two-branched thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The plant is part of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value.
